thread.title: Stipe Miocic vs. Andrei Arlovski set for the co-main event at UFC 195
thread.title_full: Stipe Miocic vs. Andrei Arlovski set for the co-main event at UFC 195 | Examiner.com

author: Jacob Hull
title: Stipe Miocic vs. Andrei Arlovski set for the co-main event at UFC 195
text:
Stipe Miocic Photo by David Mariuz/Getty Images Just a week after pulling out of his fight against Ben Rothwell due to injury, Stipe Miocic already has his next fight booked.
The Cleveland , Ohio native will take on Andrei Arlovski in the co-main event at UFC 195 in Las Vegas at the MGM Grand Garden Arena on Jan. 2. The Los Angeles Times was first to report the story and has since been confirmed by UFC officials on Wednesday afternoon.
Miocic, 33, is coming off a dominant victory over Mark Hunt at UFC Fight Night 65. The No. 3 ranked UFC heavyweight set a UFC record by landing 361 total strikes in the fight.
The former Cleveland State baseball player has finished nine of his 13 wins by knockout. Miocic has only lost twice in his career and one of those losses was to former champ Junior dos Santos.
Arlovski, 36, has surprised everyone and turned his career around after going through a tough stretch starting in 2009. The former UFC champ lost four straight fights and was knocked out in the first round in three of those four losses.
Since then, Arlovski has won 10 out of his 11 fights and is currently on a six-fight winning streak. The No. 4 ranked UFC heavyweight is coming off a unanimous decision win over Frank Mir at UFC 191.
UFC 195 is expected to be headlined by a welterweight title fight between champ Robbie Lawler and Carlos Condit. Also on the card, Erik Koch will take on Drew Dober and Edgar Garcia will take on Sheldon Westcott.
